page.title: 16WELFARE OF CATTERICK AREA
page.content: All local planning has to be authorised by Richmondshire District Council who are very strict about any changes made to the area. Their aim is to maintain the natural beauty of the area. However, if local concern is felt over some changes the council plan, residents do not hesitate to voice their opinions. Discord has arisen between residents and both district and county councils over such issues as new roadways, rights of way, bridle paths and proposed gypsy encampments. Parish councillers do their utmost to see that local opinions are taken into account. Not only on the landscape aspect but also on the upkeep of the maintenance of housing, schools and public buildings. This is an area of affluence and social concern will keep that away.
